results.title: It feels like you're left out of the world: experiencing learning disabilities
results.creator_credit: Barrie Angus McLean, Robert Anderson Associates and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Learning Series”.
Children speak of their attitudes towards their own learning disabilities, and of the way in which their life has been affected by these disabilities. Articulates the personal and social consequences of having a learning problem - the feeling of being a failure is a classroom lesson that many of these children never forget. Shows that the children given time and special help, their problems can be overcome.

results.title: Queensland
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Beginning with Brisbane’s elegant houses, this Queensland travel video also moves inland and along the expansive coastline. Enjoy the recreational activities on Hamilton Island, join a backpack tour that includes scuba diving, bush walking and horse riding, experience the Stockman’s Hall of Fame and the waterhole which inspired the Waltzing Matilda legend, visit the beaches of Surfer’s Paradise and Noosa, kayak in the Daintree Forest or sail to tranquil locations in the Whitsuday Islands.

results.title: On the Road to Survival
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Jack Absalom’s outback Australia series”.
Survival, says Jack Absalom, is a matter of commonsense and preparedness. In this film he demonstrates the techniques for safe travel that he has developed in his many years in the Outback. The program recreates a simple vehicle breakdown and highlights the potential for a tragedy. Rated: PG

results.title: Holiday
results.brief_description: From ABC Television’s award-winning and popularly acclaimed travel program ‘Holiday’ comes a series of eight fabulous videos covering every facet of holidaying in the states and territories of Australia. Whether you’re looking for a luxury five star resort or the chance to get off the beaten track, this series has got Australia covered.

results.title: On the Strzelecki Track
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Jack Absalom’s outback Australia series”.
Strezelecki was an early Polish explorer and surveyor. His name is given to one of the most desolate regions of the Outback. Jack Absalom traces the Strezelecki Track from the grand beauty of the Flinders Ranges, once the ancient coastline of the Australian continent, north to Cooper’s Creek where in ancient times thousands of Aborigines lived in a paradise surrounded by desert. Many early English explorers of the continent perished here but true bushmen achieved remarkable feats. Rated: G

results.title: Tasmania
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Tasmania’s attractions highlighted in this video range from the picturesque landscapes of Cataract Gorge, Cradle Mountain and Flinders Island to relaxing sporting events such as fishing at London Lakes and viewing the Targa Road Race. Visit historical Port Arthur, Hawley House and the grave of Tom Roberts and indulge in a novelty stop-over at a reproduction Swiss Village.

results.title: Technology at work (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Chris Thomas, Riverfront Pictures and TVC London
results.brief_description: Technological innovations have radically changed the workplace and this video examines the way that they have changed the role of workers, whether by loss of jobs or a change in work methods. Factory, office and retail employees are questioned about how the changes were introduced, whether they were given adequate training and the effect it has had on them.

results.title: Steps of Sturt
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Jack Absalom’s outback Australia series”.
From his home at Broken Hill, Jack Absalom retraces the journey of the English explorer Charles Sturt who was convinced the centre of Australia contained a vast inland sea. Sturt’s journey was one of great hardship as his party was drought bound for over six months at one location, ravaged by scurvy and attacked by wild Aborigines on whose waters the party had camped. The story tells of the gold rush following Sturt’s explorations, of the perils still to be encountered and some novel direction finding techniques.
